content.description: <math alttext="Q of t, equals, 3 times e raised to the negative 0.7, t power, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t over 3, close parenthesis, plus 0.01 times the sine of, open parenthesis, 4, t, close parenthesis, minus 0.02, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 4, t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.7</mn></mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.01</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.02</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above models the electric charge, measured in coulombs, inside a lightbulb <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> seconds after it is turned on. Which of the following presents the method for finding the instantaneous rate of change of the lightbulb’s electric charge, in coulombs per second, at time <math alttext="t equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q double prime of 4, equals, negative 0.213" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.213</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Q prime of 4, equals, negative 0.171" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.171</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q of 4, minus Q of 0, and denominator 4 minus 0, end fraction, equals, 0.053" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>0.053</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Q prime of 4, equals, negative 0.171" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.171</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
